com.hippikon.security
Class ProtectedResourceWrapper

java.lang.Object
  com.hippikon.security.ProtectedResourceWrapper
public class ProtectedResourceWrapper
extends java.lang.Object

This class is provided as a utility to find the overridden resource name of a ProtectedResource. This is necessary for a number of reasons:

  • We needed a static method in the ProtectedResource abstract class in order to handle object instantiation from a Class
  • The ProtectedResource class cannot define the getResourceName() method as abstract AND static, but it needs to be static
  • Since we pass ProtectedResource objects around, we would get the return value from the ProtectedResource static method instead of the overridden method because of interface hiding. In this case we need to ensure the subtype method is invoked without a narrow-cast (since we don't know the real type of the object being passed in).
This class therefore uses reflection to invoke the overridden method instead - tricky but true

Since:
JDK 1.2.2
Version:
$Id: ProtectedResourceWrapper.html,v 1.1.1.1 2005/06/20 21:00:54 dalehippikon Exp $
Author:
Dale Churchett
